alert.note: Alert for Carlton, South St. Louis; Central St. Louis; Northern Cook, Northern Lake; Southern Lake, North Shore (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 9:13PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern St. Louis, southwestern Lake, northwestern Bayfield and northeastern Douglas Counties through 945 PM CDT... At 912 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles east of Boulder Lake, to 6 miles southeast of Stoney Point, to 6 miles south of Lake Nebagamon, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Locations impacted include... Two Harbors, Silver Bay, Iron River, Lake Nebagamon, Maple, Brule, Poplar, Oulu, Port Wing, Beaver Bay, Boulder Lake, Ino, Herbster, Larsmont, Split Rock Lighthouse, Castle Danger, Cornucopia, Knife River, Thomas Lake Near Brimson, and Highland Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northeastern Minnesota. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for northeastern Minnesota...and northwestern Wisconsin.

area.areaDesc: Carlton, South St. Louis; Central St. Louis; Northern Cook, Northern Lake; Southern Lake, North Shore
